outputs.output_descr: Construction of the Administration Building of the JAIP for future use of the end-user, the PIEFZA Authority, the developers and the Park stakeholders, for an approximate area of 1,000 sqm (1 dunum) The project also includes the procurement of furniture as per management plan and the connection to the sewage system

The project, which aims at providing basing infrastructure for the energy supply of the JAIP, includes the construction of the main substation, supply and installation of a 15MVA transformer and all corresponding material and equipment, and connection to the Jerusalem District Electricity Company (JDECO) distribution grid. JDECO will provide a temporary 15MVA transformer while procuring a new one.

The project supports the provision of a Director General, whose recruitment process is managed and owned by MoNE through a consultancy contract. UNDP will act as an observer for fairness and transparency recruitment, and will own the financial management of the project which will cover the DG salary and allowances for 2 years. UNDP will also participate in the project committee for monitoring and supervision of the DG performances.

The project aims to supply the Jericho Agro-Industrial Park JAIP with services that will support the functionality and accessibility of the JAIP facility for the developers. 

The project scope includes4 components:

1. 	Construction of a Waste Water Pumping Station and connection pipe in the West Bank: The proposed component aims at supplying the existing JAIP sewage network with a permanent pumping station. That sewage pumping station will pump periodically the accumulated influx of sewage from the Park through a proposed 680 meters 6 inch-diameter steel pipe to the central Jerichowastewater treatment plant.

2.Construction of electricity transmission line in the West Bank:The proposed component aims at supporting the power supply to the Jericho Agro-Industrial Park through the construction of an underground 33 kV transmission lineof approximately 4 Km long extending from theJerusalem District Electricity Company (JDECO)Dead Sea Power Station to the Industrial Park Power Substation.

3.Construction of Shallow water well(s) in the Jordan valley: The proposed component aims at completing the system water provision to the JAIP.  A shallow water well will be constructed to feed into the existing water connection system in order to ensure and stabilize water provision to the JAIP. The amount of municipal water provided by the existing elevated tank is 500M3 whilst the anticipated daily water need for the PARK is 1000M3. Hence, supplementary source of water will be through shallow well(s), which should yield 500M3. 

4.	Support of employment generation in the West Bank (Industrial hangar):the project will comprise the construction of one industrial hangar of approximately 8,000 square meters (up to funding availability) to provide additional space and logistical support for future tenants. The hangar will be in addition to the one that is under construction by JAIP, and it will besupplied with all needed services such as water and electricity.
Extension of a Water Network to Service Jericho Southern Area Mainly the Future Jericho Agro-Industrial Park (JAIP)

As part of the Governemnt of Japan, "Corrdidor for peace and Prosperity" initiative, a feasability study was undertaken by the Japanese International Cooperation Agency (JICA) for the Development of a Agro-Industrial Park in the Jordan River Rift Valley. The study developed a three stage concept for the future works.

project_descr: Support to the construction of the Jericho Agro Industrial Park - Stage I. This project includes several phases and projects.
project_title: P1 - Construction of the Jericho Agro-Industrial Park
